shortcuts.title: "Active object is not a selected mesh"
shortcuts.shortcut: Shift+click the mesh last so it's active
content: Problem

shortcuts.title: Add
content: Shift + A adds new data.

Depending on the context, this can be a new object, a new mesh inside the active object or a
                            new node.

shortcuts.title: Add Face
content: F to add a new face to the mesh. Adds a loose edge if two separate vertices are selected.
Alt + F to fill Ngons with triangles.
Ctrl + F to bring up all face options including "Grid Fill"

shortcuts.title: Add to Selection
content: Shift + Left Mouse on unselected to add to the selection.
Shift + Left Mouse on selected to remove from the selection.

shortcuts.title: Apply
content: Only in Object Mode
Ctrl + A to apply changes to the transform.
Applies modifiers if hovered in the list.

shortcuts.title: Apply transforms
content: Use Ctrl+A to apply transforms.

shortcuts.title: Axis View
content: Num 1, Num 3 & Num 7 to view from Front, Side & Top.
Num 9 to Invert the current view direction.
Num 5 to toggle Orthographic view.
Num 2, Num 4, Num 6, Num 8 to Rotate the view in 15° steps.

shortcuts.title: Back to normal select
content: Use W or Escape to back to normal select.

shortcuts.title: Bevel
content: Ctrl + B to bevel edges.
Ctrl + Shift + B to bevel vertices.
Roll the Mouse Wheel to adjust the number of segments.
V to toggle vertex bevel.
C to toggle clamping.
P to adjust the bevel profile.

shortcuts.title: Box select
content: Use B to box select.

shortcuts.title: Camera View
content: Numpad 0 to align the view with the scene camera.
Ctrl + Numpad 0 to align the view with the selected camera and make it the scene camera.
Ctrl + Alt + Numpad 0 to align the scene camera with the current view.

shortcuts.title: Change Mode
content: Ctrl + Tab to see all available modes.
Tab to toggle Edit mode directly.
If the cursor is hovering a timeline, Ctrl + Tab to toggle graph view.

shortcuts.title: Change Pivot Point
content: For mirroring around center:
1. Shift+S → Cursor to World Origin
2. . (period) → 3D Cursor
3. Ctrl+M → X/Y/Z
Note: If "Cursor to Selected" puts cursor at origin, the object's origin is at (0,0,0) but geometry is elsewhere. Go into Edit Mode, select all (A), then Shift+S → Cursor to Selected.

shortcuts.title: Change Shading
content: Shift + Z to toggle Wireframe and X-ray , to see and select through the mesh.
Alt + Z to only toggle X-ray.

shortcuts.title: Change View
content: Drag Middle Mouse to Rotate the view. It rotates around an invisible Point of Interest.
Hold Shift and drag to Move the point of interest.
Hold Ctrl and drag or roll the Mouse Wheel to Zoom in and out

shortcuts.title: Circle around cursor
shortcuts.shortcut: Circle Select is on. Press W to exit
content: Problem

shortcuts.title: Circle select
content: Use C to circle select.

shortcuts.title: Clear parent
content: "Loop in parents" error = circular reference. Clear parent first with Alt+P.

shortcuts.title: Clear Transform
content: Only in Object Mode
Alt + G to clear location.
Alt + R to clear rotation.
Alt + S to clear scale.

shortcuts.title: Connect Path
content: J to connect vertices in the order in which they were selected.
Cuts into faces and creates additional vertices when the path intersects with existing edges.

shortcuts.title: Copy location between objects
content: Use Use 3D cursor method (Shift+S) to copy location between objects.

shortcuts.title: Cursor to Selected
content: For mirroring around center:
1. Shift+S → Cursor to World Origin
2. . (period) → 3D Cursor
3. Ctrl+M → X/Y/Z
Note: If "Cursor to Selected" puts cursor at origin, the object's origin is at (0,0,0) but geometry is elsewhere. Go into Edit Mode, select all (A), then Shift+S → Cursor to Selected.

shortcuts.title: Cursor to World Origin
content: For mirroring around center:
1. Shift+S → Cursor to World Origin
2. . (period) → 3D Cursor
3. Ctrl+M → X/Y/Z
Note: If "Cursor to Selected" puts cursor at origin, the object's origin is at (0,0,0) but geometry is elsewhere. Go into Edit Mode, select all (A), then Shift+S → Cursor to Selected.

shortcuts.title: Delete
content: Press X in Object Mode to delete selected objects.
Press X in Edit Mode to delete selected vertices, edges or faces.

shortcuts.title: Deselect all
content: Use Alt+A to deselect all.

shortcuts.title: Dissolve
content: Ctrl + X to delete vertices but connect the surrounding edges. The result is based on the selection mode.
X > Limited Dissolve dissolves all vertices/edges below a treshold angle.

shortcuts.title: Duplicate
content: Shift + D to duplicate the selection.
Alt + D in Object Mode to create Linked Duplicates, which reference the original data instead of copying it.

shortcuts.title: Duplicate (independent copy)
content: Use Shift+D to duplicate (independent copy).

shortcuts.title: Duplicate (linked instance)
content: Use Alt+D to duplicate (linked instance).

shortcuts.title: Everything moves together
shortcuts.shortcut: Proportional Editing is on. Press O
content: Problem

shortcuts.title: Extrude
content: E to extrude a connected copy of the selected mesh and wait for input to be moved.
ESC or Right click to end the extrusion without moving it. Creates "doubles"!
Alt + E for more options.

shortcuts.title: Extrude to Cursor
content: Ctrl + Right Mouse to extrude to the cursor position and adjust the rotation of the previous segment.
Extrusions will be placed at the depth of the 3D cursor.

shortcuts.title: Fine control on values
content: Use Shift+drag to fine control on values.

shortcuts.title: Frame Selected
content: Numpad . to set the Point of Interest to the current selection.
Numpad ∕ to toggle Local View which also hides all but the selected object.

shortcuts.title: Geometry nodes slowing scene
content: Problem

shortcuts.title: Granular Input
content: Hold Shift to divide the mouse input for more precise control.
Works with Move, Rotate and Scale as well as Sliders

shortcuts.title: Hide
content: H to hide the selection.
Shift + H to hide everything but the selection.
Alt + H to unhide all.
Meshes that are hidden in Edit Mode are visible in Object Mode.

shortcuts.title: Insert keyframe
content: Keyframe options:
- All Channels = location, rotation, scale
- Selected Channels = only what's selected in Dope Sheet
- In Active Group = specific channel group

shortcuts.title: Inset
content: I to inset around the selected faces.
Press I again to inset individual faces.
Press O to toggle outset.
Press B to toggle boundary.

shortcuts.title: Instance texture not showing
shortcuts.shortcut: Check UV map active render icon in Data Properties
content: Problem

shortcuts.title: Instances
content: - Alt+D creates linked instance (shares mesh data)
- Shift+D creates independent copy
- To verify instance: check mesh name in Object Data Properties — number shows how many objects share it
- To make instance independent: Object → Relations → Make Single User → Object & Data
- Continue instance chain with Alt+D from any instance

shortcuts.title: Join objects
content: Use Ctrl+J to join objects.

shortcuts.title: Keyframe specific value
content: Keyframe options:
- All Channels = location, rotation, scale
- Selected Channels = only what's selected in Dope Sheet
- In Active Group = specific channel group

shortcuts.title: Loop Cut
content: Ctrl + R to cut a loop if faces into segments.
Roll the Mouse Wheel to change the number of segments.
Only works on multiple faces if they are four-sided ("quads").

shortcuts.title: Merge
content: Merge all selected vertices at a specified location.
Merge By Distance to remove vertices that are closer than the threshold value, which you can set in the context menu.

shortcuts.title: Mirror
content: Use Ctrl+M → X/Y/Z to mirror.

shortcuts.title: Modifiers & Collections
content: Collection Instance:
- Add → Collection Instance → pick collection
- Or: Shift+A → Collection Instance
Exclude from View Layer:
- Checkbox in Outliner — removes collection entirely from view layer
- Different from eye icon (hide) which is temporary
Boolean Modifier:
- Used for wipe/reveal effects
- Intersect = only show overlapping geometry

shortcuts.title: Move
content: Press X, Y or Z to lock to an axis. Press twice to switch from global to local axes.
Shift + X, Y or Z to exclude an axis.
In Edit Mode, press G twice to slide along existing edges.

shortcuts.title: Multi-Edit
content: If you have multiple objects selected, editing parameters will only affect the active object.
Hold Alt to change the parameters of all selected objects instead.

shortcuts.title: Object greyed out in Outliner
content: Problem

shortcuts.title: Parent to object
shortcuts.shortcut: Select children, Shift+click parent, Ctrl+P → Object
content: "Loop in parents" error = circular reference. Clear parent first with Alt+P.

shortcuts.title: Proportional Editing
content: O to toggle proportional editing.
Roll the Mouse Wheel to change the radius.
Shift + O to change the falloff profile.

shortcuts.title: Rename
content: F2 to rename the active object.
Ctrl + F2 to Batch Rename several objects at once.

shortcuts.title: Repeat Last
content: Shift + R to repeat the last action.
Repeats Move, Rotate and Scale relative to the result of the previous action.

shortcuts.title: Repeat last action
content: Use Shift+R to repeat last action.

shortcuts.title: Rip
content: V to rip vertices or edges.
The rip direction is determined by the cursor position.

shortcuts.title: Rotate
content: Press X, Y or Z to lock to an axis. Press twice to switch from global to local axes.
Shift + X, Y or Z to exclude an axis.
Press R twice to switch to gimbal mode.

shortcuts.title: Scale
content: Press X, Y or Z to lock to an axis. Press twice to switch from global to local axes.
Shift + X, Y or Z to exclude an axis.

shortcuts.title: Search
content: F3 to open operator search.
Arrow Up and Arrow Down to navigate, Enter to select.

shortcuts.title: Select all
content: Use A to select all.

shortcuts.title: Select All
content: A to select all objects, meshes, keyframes etc. depending the context.
Alt + A to deselect all.

shortcuts.title: Select all in collection's children
content: Use Select objects, Shift+L → Object Data to select all in collection's children.

shortcuts.title: Select Linked
content: L to select all linked vertices under the cursor.
Shift + L to remove all linked vertices from the selection
Ctrl + L to select what is linked to the current selection.

shortcuts.title: Select Loop
content: Alt + Left Mouse while the cursor is close to a crossing edge.
Alt+Shift+Left Mouse to add or remove loops from the selection.
Only works on multiple faces if they are four-sided ("quads").

shortcuts.title: Select More / Less
content: Ctrl + Num + to select more.
Ctrl + Num - to select less.
Ctrl + Shift + Num + to select more elements with the same distance as the last two.

shortcuts.title: Select Path / Area
content: Ctrl+Left Mouse to add the shortest path of vertices or faces to the selection.
Ctrl+Shift+Left Mouse to add or remove an area.

shortcuts.title: Select Similar
content: Ctrl + G to select all with similar traits to the current selection.
Also works with objects or nodes selected (Select Grouped)

shortcuts.title: Selection Modes
content: 1 for vertex select.
2 for edge select.
3 for face select.
Switching modes can change the selection!

shortcuts.title: Selection to Cursor
content: For mirroring around center:
1. Shift+S → Cursor to World Origin
2. . (period) → 3D Cursor
3. Ctrl+M → X/Y/Z
Note: If "Cursor to Selected" puts cursor at origin, the object's origin is at (0,0,0) but geometry is elsewhere. Go into Edit Mode, select all (A), then Shift+S → Cursor to Selected.

shortcuts.title: Separate
content: P to separate the selection into a new object.
The new object will have the same modifiers as the object it was separated from.

shortcuts.title: Separate by loose parts
shortcuts.shortcut: P → By Loose Parts (in Edit Mode)
content: Use P → By Loose Parts (in Edit Mode) to separate by loose parts.

shortcuts.title: Set origin to geometry
shortcuts.shortcut: Right-click → Set Origin → Origin to Geometry
content: Use Right-click → Set Origin → Origin to Geometry to set origin to geometry.

shortcuts.title: Shrink/Fatten
content: In Edit Mode, Alt + S to move vertices along their vertex normals.

shortcuts.title: Smart UV Project
content: Important: Check UV Maps in Data Properties (green triangle). The "active render" camera icon must be checked, and make sure correct UV map is active (not "automap").

shortcuts.title: Snap
content: Move one thing precisely to another, especially useful to position the 3D Cursor.
Shift + Right Mouse to set the 3D cursor by hand.

shortcuts.title: Snap (Toggle)
content: Hold Ctrl to enable snapping.
Works with Move, Rotate and Scale as well as Sliders
You can snap to increments (default) or geometry (vertices, edges, faces).

shortcuts.title: Solid view
content: Use Z → Solid to solid view.

shortcuts.title: Split
content: Y to split the selection.
Alt + M to split all selected faces by their edges.
The selection is disconnected but still part of the same data block and object.

shortcuts.title: Subdivision Surface
content: Ctrl + 1, 2, 3 to add a subdivision surface modifier with corresponding levels.
Ctrl + 0 will disable the modifier (level 0).

shortcuts.title: Switch Object
content: Alt + Q to switch to the hovered object without changing modes.
Works with all modes, including Pose Mode on Armature objects.

shortcuts.title: To Sphere
content: Shift + Alt + S moves selected vertices to approach a sphere with the 3D cursor at the center.
Turns a single loop of vertices into a circle.

shortcuts.title: Toggle Edit/Object mode
content: Use Tab to toggle edit/object mode.

shortcuts.title: Toggle on/off
content: Warning: If everything moves when you move one object, proportional editing is ON. Press O to turn it off.

shortcuts.title: Unhide all
content: Use Alt+H to unhide all.

shortcuts.title: Unwrap
content: Important: Check UV Maps in Data Properties (green triangle). The "active render" camera icon must be checked, and make sure correct UV map is active (not "automap").

shortcuts.title: Wireframe view
content: Use Z → Wireframe to wireframe view.

shortcuts.title: Zoom to selected (Outliner)
content: Use Numpad . to zoom to selected (outliner).
